comments: Easiest class! There is no reason not to pass her class because the tests are just like the study guides. Use the textbook to find the answers to the study guide and go over it once or twice and youll be good for the test. Apart from the tests, you have weeks to finish your 2 papers so get that done. Shes also pretty lenient with grading.

comments: I had Prof Murdoch for Intro to Humanities and really enjoyed her class. We wrote 2 essays, gave a PowerPoint presentation, and had a few tests. She gave us study guides for the test, so there was no reason to do poorly on them unless you didnt study. Also (maybe this is weird) her voice was very soothing and it always made me feel relaxed.

comments: Miss Murdoch was amazing. Very straightforward and made class fun. Also extremely caring and sweet. She always brought in snacks for us on the days we had tests and always provided study guides.

comments: She\'s a good professor who encourages the class to ask questions and she makes sure the assignments and tests instructions are 100% clear. As long as you fill out the study guides and read them once or twice, you\'ll pass her tests.

tag_professor: Clear grading criteria (12)  Gives good feedback (10)  Inspirational (10)  Caring (8)  LECTURE HEAVY (7)  Respected (6)  Participation matters (4)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (4)  Amazing lectures (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Get ready to read (1)
stu_tags: LECTURE HEAVY  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA
comments: There were 2 papers, 5 tests and 1 presentation. The papers were the easiest A\'s ever, you don\'t even need to meet the word count. For the tests, as long as you do the study guide, you\'ll pass, they are identicial. The presentation was super easy as well. Her lectures are boring and the book teaches you everything but she takes attendance.

comments: Really nice seems scary at first, but that is because she wants to be taken seriously. I remember you have a power point due at the end and if you study the study guide you are good.(be sure you really know the material because the way she asks questions in the tests makes your head turn a bit XD) all you need is the notes from what she goes over

comments: Murdoch is very knowledgeable and she knows Humanities very well. She can seem kind of monotone, at times, but she goes over everything on the study guide. Her study guides are pretty much replicas of her tests. Overall, she is approachable, and this is an extremely easy class with her.

comments: Prof. Murdoch is an awesome teacher. She assigns 2 papers and a powerpoint presentation for her HUM2020 (along with tests) and as long as you show up and do the tests, papers and presentations as she asks on the sylabus you will get a good grade i just recieved a 100 on my presentation and a 95 on my first paper so she is an easy grader.

comments: I love Prof Murdoch! She is such a chill and humble person. Her classes are done through slideshow presentations and through the book. Just takes notes and complete the study guides she uploads to PAL and you\'ll pass her tests with no problem. A few papers but all very creative and interesting. Taken every class she offers.

comments: Very kind professor and does her best to keep the class engaged. Sometimes she sways off topic and then some days she goes on forever about a topic. Her lectures get lengthy and she shows lots of clips. Participation counts and helps move the class along. I never used the book as she gives handouts. grading is tough but you don\'t have many papers.

comments: Loved this professor and this class! Would recommend to anyone who has a busy work schedule and is decent with time management. She is a very insight professor and I certainly left the class with a new love for humanities

comments: Professor Murdoch was a great professor. She was very caring and really strove to help her students succeed. Make sure to study for her tests, as she gives clear study guides that are very helpful. She is very engaging, and encourages discussion about subject matter.

comments: Mrs. Murdoch is a nice and caring professor! Her class is super easy. The study guide is super helpful and the only thing you really need to study. This class is an easy A. I would take her again if she taught other humanities classes! Take her!!!!!! You won\'t regret it.
